meanings.definition: Having a stronger hold or grasp.
meanings.sent1: The new gloves are gripier than the old ones.
meanings.sent2: She needed a gripier handle to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent3: The monkey found the gripier branch and swung happily.
meanings.sent4: His gripier determination led him to success.
meanings.sent5: The gripier Velcro kept the shoes securely fastened.

meanings.definition: Tending to grip or hold onto something tightly.
meanings.sent1: The baby's gripier hands held onto the toy.
meanings.sent2: The cat's gripier claws left marks on the furniture.
meanings.sent3: The gripier child refused to let go of the balloon.
meanings.sent4: Her gripier hug conveyed her love for him.
meanings.sent5: The gripier handshake showed his sincerity.

meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to complain or be dissatisfied.
meanings.sent1: The gripier customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent2: She became gripier as the wait time increased.
meanings.sent3: The gripier student groaned loudly during the test.
meanings.sent4: His gripier attitude made it challenging to please him.
meanings.sent5: The gripier traveler left a scathing review online.
